text: As for the "regulating parent-child contact on faith basis" claim, I think it's fair to say you're not very familiar with the Mormon missionary experience/culture/program. Not sure how productive this conversation can be until you've "educated" yourself.
author: mckaycoppins

text: As far as I can tell, one of the primary agents of change in her life was attending Brigham Young University—a Mormon institution! Your analysis doesn't seem to account for the many religious people who are also well-educated. Tara's story was remarkable because it was rare.
author: mckaycoppins

text: The assumption underlying your analysis here is that religious people are being forced or manipulated, rather than thoughtfully considering what they believe and then making personal choices.
author: mckaycoppins

text: I love "Educated," but would suggest not using it as an guide to understanding mainstream Mormonism or the Mormon experience.
author: mckaycoppins

text: For a long time—and in much the world—regular long-distance calls home were expensive and hard to pull off. That's not the case anymore, and I'm glad they've updated the policy. (But still write emails home, missionaries! You'll want to look back on them someday!)
author: mckaycoppins

text: There were various reasons for this policy. Part of it was to limit distraction/homesickness (which worked in my case as a young missionary, but probably had the opposite effect for others). A lot of it was also about logistics.
author: mckaycoppins

text: I've read it. It's great! Tara makes it pretty clear in the book, though, that hers was *far* from a normal Mormon experience (something I can attest to having also grown up Mormon!)
author: mckaycoppins

text: This will be a major change to the Mormon missionary experience. Up until now, they could email with friends and family every week, but they were only allowed to call/Skype home twice a year (on Christmas and Mother's Day).
author: mckaycoppins

text: Enjoy your life.
author: mckaycoppins

text: Congratulations!
author: mckaycoppins

text: There have been many short-sighted/self-interested presidents before him. But Trump seems unique in how little he thinks or cares about the unintended consequences of his actions—particularly those that will play out after he leaves office.
author: mckaycoppins

text: "There are currently over 5,000 Amazon employees in Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Staten Island, and we plan to continue growing these teams."
